intro: Hierobotana inflata, commonly known as the inflated bladderwort, is a unique aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its inflated, bladder-like structures that function as traps for small aquatic organisms. These bladders are typically filled with air and can be found attached to submerged stems. The plant is native to freshwater habitats in South America, particularly in regions with slow-moving water. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for studying aquatic plant adaptations and carnivorous mechanisms.
